title: 113_hr533
content: The "Land Management Workforce Flexibility Act" is cited as the short title. It amends personnel flexibilities relating to land management agencies in the United States Code by adding a new chapter 96. The Land Management Workforce Flexibility Act defines 'land management agency' to include specific departments like the Forest Service and the Bureau of Land Management. It allows employees under time-limited appointments in the competitive service to compete for permanent positions within the agency. The Land Management Workforce Flexibility Act allows employees in time-limited appointments in the competitive service to compete for permanent positions within the agency based on specific eligibility criteria. This includes serving for at least 24 months without a break of 2 years, maintaining acceptable performance levels, and meeting qualifications for a successor permanent position. The Land Management Workforce Flexibility Act allows employees in time-limited appointments to compete for permanent positions within the agency based on specific eligibility criteria, such as serving for at least 24 months without a break, maintaining performance levels, and meeting qualifications for the successor permanent position. The Land Management Workforce Flexibility Act allows time-limited employees to compete for permanent positions within the agency if they meet specific eligibility criteria, such as serving for at least 24 months without a break, maintaining acceptable performance levels, and meeting qualification requirements. Preference is given to eligible veterans, and placement is determined by competitive procedures if multiple employees have equal priority for conversion. Employees selected or converted under this section become career-conditional employees and acquire competitive status upon appointment. Preference is given to eligible veterans, and placement is determined by competitive procedures if multiple employees have equal priority for conversion. Employees selected or converted under this section become career-conditional employees and acquire competitive status upon appointment. The provisions of this section apply to time-limited employees separated for reasons other than misconduct or unacceptable performance. Time-limited appointments include temporary and term appointments, as defined by the Office of Personnel Management. The Office of Personnel Management will prescribe necessary regulations to carry out this section. Eligible veterans are given preference, and placement is determined through competitive procedures. Selected employees become career-conditional employees with competitive status.
